newsitem.title: USA: Cognitronics sees demand continuing in second half.
newsitem.headline: Cognitronics sees demand continuing in second half.

text.p: Cognitronics Corp said on Wednesday it has seen strong demand from U.S. telecommunications companies for its McIAS 16xx series products, and expects some of this momentum to continue in the second half of 1997.

Cognitronics said in a news release that its second quarter earnings of $0.42 per share, up from $0.12 for the same period a year ago, were attributable to a 162 percent increase in domestic sales, including those of the McIAS products.
Cognitronics shares were up 7/8 to 14-1/2 in late American Stock Exchange trade.
The company said its sales order backlog at the end of the second quarter was $3.1 million.
Part of the sales momentum was due to local exchange carriers building up their infrastructure to offer competitive local telephone service, Cognitronics said.
The company makes voice processing equipment.
The stock was up 15/16 at 14-9/16 in late trade.
